body_html:
@lamberta @mrry @jsimsa @MarkDaoust I am still waiting for some assistance with this. Use of TF records, even with tf.data.TFRecordDataset(<files>) can be problematic, especially with SequenceExamples in unwrapping the forced wrapped features and feating into an input_fn for a custom estimator.

My point is that it is unclear the best way to do something simple with TF records and given how much of the "higher" level apis require knowledge of lower level apis, it is just unacceptable the lack of support.

@lamberta @mrry @jsimsa @MarkDaoust  I am still waiting for some assistance with this. Use of TF records, even with tf.data.TFRecordDataset(<files>) can be problematic, especially with SequenceExamples in unwrapping the forced wrapped features and feating into an input_fn for a custom estimator.
My point is that it is unclear the best way to do something simple with TF records and given how much of the "higher" level apis require knowledge of lower level apis, it is just unacceptable the lack of support.
body:
@lamberta @mrry @jsimsa @MarkDaoust  I am still waiting for some assistance with this. Use of TF records, even with `tf.data.TFRecordDataset(<files>)` can be problematic, especially with `SequenceExamples` in unwrapping the forced wrapped features and feating into an input_fn for a custom estimator. 


My point is that it is unclear the best way to do something simple with TF records and given how much of the "higher" level apis require knowledge of lower level apis, it is just unacceptable the lack of support.
